Description: Agent/producer creates policy as submission transaction. If issue occurs and blocks quoting, approval is required from underwriter before policy is released back to agent.
Provides underwriting rules and infrastructure to manage issues. Major components: issue, rule, authority grant and profile.
Occurence of specific policy transaction where underwriting condition was true. Can stop jobs unless approved.
Describes impact of underwriting issues and how to resolve. Include conditions that raise issue.
Ability to approve issues and approval degree.
Group of authorities given to user, allowing user to approve issues.

Raised automatically based on policy choices. Rules trigger issues, and complex conditions can be written in Gosu. Automatically remvoed upon resolution. Can be added manually but then requires manual removal.
Point in job where issues can be raised, including: pre-quote, bind, pre-insurrance. Used to specify when to check for issue existence.
Stops job progress until issue is approved. Issue types can be configured as informational (non-blocking).
